subject: RE: [junit] junit4: Exceptions in TestListener
msgSnippet: Elliotte, The TestListener methods now all throw Exception. If a listener throws an exception, a failure is noted and the listener is removed (we copied this
messageBody:
Elliotte,

The TestListener methods now all throw Exception. If a listener throws an exception, a failure is noted and the listener is removed (we copied this behavior from the convention for Eclipse extensions).

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Elliotte Rusty Harold
> Sent: Tuesday, September 27, 2005 7:16 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] junit4: Exceptions in TestListener
>
> I'm trying to implement a custom TestListener in JUnit 4.
> These methods
> do I/O. They tend to look like this:
>
> public void testRunStarted(int testCount) {
> try {
> out.write("<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>\r\n");
> }
> catch (IOException ex) {
> throw new RuntimeException(ex);
> }
> }
>
> Should the TestListener interfaces be declared to throw Exception or
> some kind of JUnitException so one doesn't have to wrap
> everything in a
> RuntimeException?
>
>
